author: potuz
content:
<@412614104222531604> <@199561711278227457> is it hard to spin up a devnet with about 500K validators, and do a bunch of combinations as follows:
1. Fill the pool of one client with 500K changes pre Capella. See if they're broadcasted and all clients fill their pools at the fork
2. Fill the pool of all clients with the same 500K changes pre Capella. See that they don't explode and continue including changes (this may be impossible with Teku at least that bounds the pool, but still, fill it as much as possible)
3. Fill the pool of each client with different 500K changes (so incompatible)
4. Fill the pool of each client with 100K changes that complement each other. See that at the fork all clients have 500K changes (or their pool limits)

Does this belong to hive perhaps?

author: potuz
content: Probably the same with exits instead of bls changes

author: parithosh
content: It shouldn't be too hard to do so, just expensive. If there's a solid reason then we can go ahead and do it, I'd wait till we're closer to release versions for such a test. I'm assuming you'd want 500k to simulate mainnet? üòÑ

author: barnabasbusa
content: Pretty sure the only client that supports bls change in their pool ahead of Capella is prysm.

author: siladu
content:
Only checked teku-besu, but looks like besu is getting the bad blocks when it proposes, maybe only for certain txs.

We get receipts root mismatch e.g.:
```Invalid block: receipts root mismatch (expected=0x00562398751d131076c57bcd1161c5317d016adff05c394d5ff1c3ba026688bf, actual=0x8935f6202c66c71aaf409ac
53a7b3178dc24cfd4dab089dff8bfa304681f5096)```

It transpires that we haven't actually got this EIP-3860 spec change deployed: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/6249
so maybe that's the cause, but would have to check.

We have a fix for the initcode error handling in flight: https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/4911

author: jgm
content:
There isn't a phase0 fork version, the consensus spec only defines genesis:

```
curl -s http://node/eth/v1/config/spec | jq -s . | grep FORK_VERSION
      "GENESIS_FORK_VERSION": "0x00000000",
      "ALTAIR_FORK_VERSION": "0x01000000",
      "BELLATRIX_FORK_VERSION": "0x02000000",
```

author: parithosh
content:
I've updated the testnet doc to reflect the discussions from today:
https://notes.ethereum.org/@parithosh/zhejiang-testnet-spec

TLDR: 
- Wei to Gwei change for withdrawals
- Genesis fork version for signing the blstoexecution changes

We'd ideally have changes implemented by Monday on all clients. We'll then launch devnet-3 on tuesday. Based on its success, we'd have a public testnet(Zhejiang testnet) on thursday withe the same specs as devnet-3. 

tagging for visibility:  <@680234424037670912>  <@654267572107083777>  <@360491619402776577> <@758579010027782144> <@583892532644151312> <@687974325072035882> <@341574016160497665> (apologies to the australian folks for a weekend tagüòÖ )

author: potuz
content:
<@144468805697929216> I'm failing to verify the signature on interop. I am not sure if it's a bug on my code or the way I am generating it. I generate it as follows with `ethdo`
```
$ ethdo version
local build (latest release 1.26.1)
$ ethdo validator credentials set --private-key 0x25295f0d1d592a90b333e26e85149708208e9f8e8bc18f6c77bd62f8ad7a6866 --fork-version 0x20000089 --genesis-validators-root 0xca5aaed5f2f3f6cba33396fbe60dfebfc3a5ea5bd03349b02db841cd35df1781 --validator 0 --withdrawal-address 0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000001 --json
```
where the fork version is the right one for genesis. Should this produce the right signature?

content:

```

author: parithosh
content:
- Install kurtosis: https://docs.kurtosis.com/install
- Install docker
- Run kurtosis engine restart¬†to make sure its up
- Create `example.json`¬†and add the below data:
```
{
  "participants": [
    {
      "el_client_type": "geth",
      "el_client_image": "ethpandaops/geth:wei-to-gwei-9fcb9bb",
      "cl_client_type": "teku",
      "cl_client_image": "<your-docker-image>"
    },
    {
      "el_client_type": "geth",
      "el_client_image": "ethpandaops/geth:wei-to-gwei-9fcb9bb",
      "cl_client_type": "teku",
      "cl_client_image": "<your-docker-image>"
    },
    {
      "el_client_type": "geth",
      "el_client_image": "ethpandaops/geth:wei-to-gwei-9fcb9bb",
      "cl_client_type": "teku",
      "cl_client_image": "<your-docker-image>"
    }
  ],
  "network_params": {
    "network_id": "3151908",
    "deposit_contract_address": "0x4242424242424242424242424242424242424242",
    "seconds_per_slot": 12,
    "slots_per_epoch": 32,
    "genesis_delay": 120,
    "capella_fork_epoch": 5,
    "num_validator_keys_per_node": 64
  },
  "wait_for_finalization": true,
  "wait_for_verifications": false,
  "global_client_log_level": "info"
}
```
- `kurtosis run --enclave-id eth2 github.com/kurtosis-tech/eth2-package  "$(cat ./example.json)"`¬†to get the testnet up
